text: Thailand has had 30 prime ministers since it changed from a monarchy to a democratic regime. == List of prime ministers == Colour key (for political coalitions/parties): General categories: (12) (7) Defunct political parties: :Pre–1950: (3) (2) (1) :1950–1975: (1) (1) (1) :Post–2000: (1) (2) (1) (2) Active political parties: (6) (1) (3) (1) (1) No. Portrait Prime minister Term of office Mandate Party Government Monarch Start End Duration 1 Manopakorn Nitithada 1932 1933 — Independent Manopakorn I Prajadhipok — Manopakorn II — Manopakorn III 2 Phahon Phonphayuhasena 1933 1938 — Khana Ratsadon Phahon I 1933 Phahon II — Phahon III Ananda Mahidol 1937 Phahon IV — Phahon V 3 Plaek Phibunsongkhram 1938 1944 1938 Khana Ratsadon Plaek I — Plaek II 4 Khuang Aphaiwong 1944 1945 — Khana Ratsadon Khuang I 5 Thawi Bunyaket 1945 1945 — Khana Ratsadon Thawi 6 Seni Pramoj 1945 1946 — Free Thai Seni I (4) Khuang Aphaiwong 1946 1946 1946 Khana Ratsadon Khuang II 7 Pridi Banomyong 1946 1946 — Khana Ratsadon Pridi I Bhumibol Adulyadej — Pridi II 8 Thawan Thamrongnawasawat 1946 1947 — Constitutional Front Thawan I — Thawan II — Phin Choonhavan 1947 1947 — Military National Military Council (4) Khuang Aphaiwong 1947 1948 — Democrat Khuang III 1948 Khuang IV (3) Plaek Phibunsongkhram 1948 1957 — Conservative Plaek III — Plaek IV — Plaek V — Plaek VI 1952 Plaek VII Seri Manangkhasila Plaek VIII — Sarit Thanarat 1957 1957 — Military Revolutionary Council 9 Pote Sarasin 1957 1958 — Independent Pote 10 Thanom Kittikachorn 1958 1958 National Socialist Thanom I 11 Sarit Thanarat 1958 1963 — Military Revolutionary Council — Sarit (10) Thanom Kittikachorn 1963 1973 — Military Thanom II United Thai People 1969 Thanom III — Military Revolutionary Council — Thanom IV 12 Sanya Dharmasakti 1973 1975 — Independent Sanya I — Sanya II (6) Seni Pramoj 1975 1975 1975 Democrat Seni II 13 Kukrit Pramoj 1975 1976 — Social Action Kukrit (6) Seni Pramoj 1976 1976 1976 Democrat Seni III — Seni IV — Sangad Chaloryu 1976 1976 — Military Administration Reform Council 14 Thanin Kraivichien 1976 1977 — Independent Thanin — Sangad Chaloryu 1977 1977 — Military Revolutionary Council 15 Kriangsak Chamanan 1977 1980 — Military Kriangsak I Independent 1979 Kriangsak II 16 Prem Tinsulanonda 1980 1988 — Military Prem I Independent 1983 Prem II 1986 Prem III 17 Chatichai Choonhavan 1988 1991 1988 Thai Nation Chatichai I — Chatichai II — Sunthorn Kongsompong 1991 1991 — Military National Peace Keeping Council 18 Anand Panyarachun 1991 1992 — Independent Anand I 19 Suchinda Kraprayoon 1992 1992 Independent Suchinda — Meechai Ruchuphan 1992 1992 — Independent (18) Anand Panyarachun 1992 1992 — Independent Anand II 20 Chuan Leekpai 1992 1995 Democrat Chuan I 21 Banharn Silpa-archa 1995 1996 1995 Thai Nation Banharn 22 Chavalit Yongchaiyudh 1996 1997 1996 New Aspiration Chavalit (20) Chuan Leekpai 1997 2001 — Democrat Chuan II 23 Thaksin Shinawatra 2001 2006 2001 Thai Rak Thai Thaksin I 2005 Thaksin II — Sonthi Boonyaratglin 2006 2006 — Military Council for Democratic Reform 24 Surayud Chulanont 2006 2008 — Independent Surayud 25 Samak Sundaravej 2008 2008 2007 People's Power Samak — Somchai Wongsawat 2008 2008 — People's Power 26 2008 2008 Somchai — Chavarat Charnvirakul 2008 2008 — Independent 27 Abhisit Vejjajiva 2008 2011 — Democrat Abhisit 28 Yingluck Shinawatra 2011 2014 2011 Pheu Thai Yingluck — Niwatthamrong Boonsongpaisan 2014 2014 — Pheu Thai 29 Prayut Chan-o-cha 2014 2023 — Military National Council for Peace and Order — Prayut I Independent Vajiralongkorn 2019 Prayut II United Thai Nation — Prawit Wongsuwon 2022 2022 — Palang Pracharath 30 Srettha Thavisin 2023 2024 2023 Pheu Thai Srettha — Phumtham Wechayachai 2024 2024 — Pheu Thai 31 Paetongtarn title: List of prime ministers of Thailand
